title: Food security in drought affected regions in Somalia

Test lights and other electrical components
Attach tillage or planting implements to the tractor

Lubricate moving parts
Check fluid levels (oil, coolant, etc.)

Park equipment in designated storage area

Examine blades or other parts for excessive wear
Replace worn parts if necessary
Transport new equipment to the farm
Position equipment for setup
Secure equipment in place

Inspect tires and brakes
Ensure all safety equipment is present

subtasks: Modify attachment settings for different crop types
Set appropriate tractor speed for task
Remove guiding devices or GPS systems
Clean any residual substances on the equipment

Identify issues and record for maintenance
Adjust operation settings due to field conditions

Drive tractor and equipment through crops
Monitor equipment operation during farm tasks
Identify and extract stuck debris or rocks

Turn key to start engine
Check emissions and other indicators

subtasks: Adjust the hitch height or position

Engage the harvest implement (combine, etc.)

tasks.task: Allocating recovered soil to the right location
subtasks: Guide the soil sampler to collect from specific sites
Mark or record the location of each sample
Link or uncouple tractors from other units

Use a soil probe or moisture meter

Charge battery if necessary before use
Unload harvested crops or materials from the equipment
Remove any excess soil or material from the implements

tasks.task: Checking hoses and lines for leaks on the equipment
subtasks: Inspect hydraulic or pneumatic lines
Check for cracks, abrasions, or loose connections
Wipe down implements after use
Rinse any residue or chemicals from the tools
Clean, rinse, and dry equipment after chemical use

Record findings for future reference
